verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
saṁstūyamāno bhagavān
rājabhir mukta-bandhanaiḥ
tān āha karuṇas tāta
śaraṇyaḥ ślakṣṇayā girā

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; saṁstūyamāṇaḥ—being nicely praised; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; rājabhiḥ—by the kings; mukta—freed; bandhanaiḥ—from their bondage; tān—to them; āha—He spoke; karuṇaḥ—merciful; tāta—my dear (King Parīkṣit); śaraṇyaḥ—the giver of shelter; ślakṣṇayā—with gentle; girā—words.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Thus the kings, now freed from bondage, glorified the Supreme Lord. Then, my dear Parīkṣit, that merciful bestower of shelter spoke to them in a gentle voice.
